com.rshepard.atm

Class Gui

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rshepard.atm.Gui
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class Gui
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Gui()
      Creates and initializes the basic framework of the GUI for the ATM

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) 
      void destroy()
      Disables and removes the ATM from the screen
      void disableAllButtons()
      Disables all buttons on the entire ATM display including the West, East, keypad, cardSlot, and depositSlot buttons.
      void disableCommandButtons()
      Disables the command buttons 4 on the west side 4 on the east side and sets the text to the size of the BUTTON_PAD so that they don't shrink
      void disableEastButtons()
      Disables the 4 command buttons on the East side of the display
      void disableKeyPad()
      Disables the whole keypad including the numeric, cancel, and enter keys
      void disableNumericKeys()
      Disables just the numeric keys.
      void disableWestButtons()
      Disables the 4 command buttons on the West side of the display
      void enableCommandButtons()
      Enables all the command buttons 4 on the East side 4 on the West side
      void enableKeyPad()
      Enables the keypad, all the numeric, cancel, and enter keys

    • Method Detail

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt)
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • disableNumericKeys

        public void disableNumericKeys()
        Disables just the numeric keys. Used when the GuiController registers that 4 digits have been input for the PIN

      • disableKeyPad

        public void disableKeyPad()
        Disables the whole keypad including the numeric, cancel, and enter keys

      • enableKeyPad

        public void enableKeyPad()
        Enables the keypad, all the numeric, cancel, and enter keys

      • disableCommandButtons

        public void disableCommandButtons()
        Disables the command buttons 4 on the west side 4 on the east side and sets the text to the size of the BUTTON_PAD so that they don't shrink

      • disableEastButtons

        public void disableEastButtons()
        Disables the 4 command buttons on the East side of the display

      • disableWestButtons

        public void disableWestButtons()
        Disables the 4 command buttons on the West side of the display

      • enableCommandButtons

        public void enableCommandButtons()
        Enables all the command buttons 4 on the East side 4 on the West side

      • disableAllButtons

        public void disableAllButtons()
        Disables all buttons on the entire ATM display including the West, East, keypad, cardSlot, and depositSlot buttons.

      • setWelcomeScreen

        public void setWelcomeScreen()
        Sets and enables buttons and text for the Welcome screen.

      • setGetAccountScreen

        public void setGetAccountScreen(java.lang.String outputText)
        Sets and enables the specific buttons for the get account screen. Has a parameter for a message output depending on the method who called it.
        Parameters:
        outputText - The extra informative text to be displayed along with the default message.

      • setPinErrorScreen

        public void setPinErrorScreen()
        Sets and enables text and buttons for the error screen (PIN error and account error)

      • setPinScreen

        public void setPinScreen(java.lang.String outputText)
        Sets and enables text and buttons for the PIN entry screen. Includes method specific output text as a parameter
        Parameters:
        outputText - Extra informative text to be displayed to the user. i.e. in the case of an entry error

      • setMainScreen

        public void setMainScreen(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String account)
        Sets and enables the text and buttons associated with the Main selection screen including: name, account, and transaction selection
        Parameters:
        name - The name on the account that is displayed on the screen
        account - The account number of the user

      • setSelectAccoutScreen

        public void setSelectAccoutScreen(Selection transactionType)
        Sets and enables the text and buttons associated with the account selection screen: Checking or Savings. Also takes in a parameter of transaction type i.e. withdraw, deposit, transfer, or balance.
        Parameters:
        transactionType - the transaction to be performed i.e. withdraw, deposit, transfer, or balance.

      • setBalanceScreen

        public void setBalanceScreen(Selection selection,
                             double amount)
        Sets and enables the text and buttons associated with the balance selection screen including the account type (checking or savings) and the amount of the balance.
        Parameters:
        selection - The type of account (checking or savings)
        amount - The amount of the balance

      • setNumericInputScreen

        public void setNumericInputScreen(java.lang.String account,
                                  java.lang.String balance)
        Sets and enables the text and buttons associated with the numeric input screen i.e. input value account type and balance of the account
        Parameters:
        account - the current account being accessed
        balance - the current balance of the account

      • setDepositScreen

        public void setDepositScreen(boolean isActive)
        Sets and enables the text and buttons associated with the deposit screen and enables or disables the deposit slot button depending on the state of the transaction
        Parameters:
        isActive - enables or disables the deposit slot button depending on the state of the transaction

      • setWithdrawScreen

        public void setWithdrawScreen()
        Sets and enables the text and buttons associated with the withdraw screen i.e. preset amounts in sets of 20

      • setEndScreen

        public void setEndScreen()
        Sets and enables the text and buttons associated with the ending screen

      • setMessageScreen

        public void setMessageScreen(java.lang.String text,
                             boolean error)
        Sets and enables the text associated with a message screen
        Parameters:
        text - String of text to inform the user of transaction
        error - boolean if the message is an error screen true will set the text to red, false will set the text to green

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Disables and removes the ATM from the screen

      • isCommandButtonPressed

      • isNumericButtonPressed

        public boolean isNumericButtonPressed()
        Used by the GuiController to listen for new digits being input on the keypad
        Returns:
        the numericButtonPressed notification that a numeric key is pressed

      • isEnterButtonPressed

        public boolean isEnterButtonPressed()
        Used by the GuiController to listen for enter button presses
        Returns:
        the enterButtonPressed notification that the enter key is pressed

      • isCancelButtonPressed

        Used by the GuiController to listen for cancel button presses
        Returns:
        the cancelButtonPressed notification that the cancel key is pressed

      • isCardInserted

        public boolean isCardInserted()
        Used by the GuiController to listen for the card being inserted
        Returns:
        the cardInserted notification that the card is inserted
